cfc_income: Controlled Foreign Corporation Rules: Income
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest Deduction Limitations

cfc_income: CFC exempt if it passes the active income test and narrower rules apply if located in a “listed” country.
thin_capitalization_rules: 1.5:1 debt-to-equity ratio (15:1 for financial institutions) applies

cfc_income: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest limitation rule applies for "excessive borrowing costs," i.e., costs greater than EUR 3 million and greater than 30% of adjusted EBITDA; arm's length standard applicable

cfc_income: Effective tax rate exemption.
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of EUR 3 million or 30% of EBITDA

5:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies to intragroup loans

1:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies to receivables from shareholders or directors, managers, and liquidators

country_limitations: Countries with a tax treaty or Tax Information Exchange Agreement
cfc_income: Multiple rules may exempt CFC from taxation.
thin_capitalization_rules: 1.5:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

cfc_income: Exemptions based on share of passive income.
thin_capitalization_rules:
3:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

A 35% surtax for excessive-indebtedness can apply

country_limitations: Applicable to holding companies, no country restrictions
cfc_income: If less than 80% of total income is passive, then all income is exempt.
thin_capitalization_rules:
2:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

Certain exemptions apply

cfc_income: N/A
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions are limited to 30% of EBITDA

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
cfc_income: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted and an effective tax rate exemption.
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of CZK 80 million or 30% of EBITDA

4:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 debt-to-equity ratio for certain financial services companies) applies

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
cfc_income: Foreign subsidiaries are exempt if less than 1/3 of their income is financial income.
thin_capitalization_rules:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

Interest deductions are limited to 2.3% of assets and to 30% of EBITDA

Other rules can apply

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states and Switzerland
cfc_income:
CFCs in countries that are Estonian tax treaty partners are exempt.

A CFC is exempt if the entity has accounting profits of no more than EUR 750,000 and non-trading income of no more than EUR 75,000.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of EUR 3 million or 30% of EBITDA

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
cfc_income:
No exemption if CFC is in a blacklist jurisdiction. Exemption applies if CFC is in white-list jurisdiction (based on exchange of information agreements).

Other exemptions apply based on activities and substance.
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA

Net interest expenses between non-related parties limited to EUR 3 million

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement or if CFC carries out trading or manufacturing (commercial or industrial) activity.
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of EUR 3 million or 30% of EBITDA

Different limits apply to related-party debt

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds EUR 3 million

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds EUR 3 million

cfc_income:
CFC exempt if located in EU, OECD, EEA, and treaty countries and not an artificial arrangement.

Accounting profits not to exceed HUF 243,952,500 and non-trading income does not exceed HUF 24,395,250.

Accounting profits not more than 10% of its operating costs.
cfc_exemption: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of HUF 939,810,000 (~ EUR 2.5 million) or 30% of EBITDA

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EEA countries, or has a double-tax treaty with Iceland and not an artificial arrangement.
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA

Rule does not apply if total interest paid does not exceed ISK 100 million

Other exemptions can apply

country_limitations: EU member states and tax treaty countries
cfc_income:
Exclusions include:

CFC with accounting profits of EUR 750,000 or less and non- trading income of EUR 75,000 or less or accounting profits of EUR 75,000 or less.

Transfer pricing exemption.

Essential purpose test, income that comes from arrangements that do not have the purpose to secure a tax advantage.

Several exemptions do not apply if the CFC is in jurisdiction on the EU list of non-cooperative jurisdictions.
cfc_exemption: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
thin_capitalization_rules: Deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA, exemption for borrowing costs of less than EUR 3 million.

cfc_income: CFC exempt if at least 15% effective tax rate and if CFC is publicly traded.
thin_capitalization_rules: None

cfc_income: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA

cfc_income: Exemptions exist for economic substance and certain control/location criteria.
cfc_exemption: Primarily passive (all income of “paper,” “cash box,” or “blacklisted” companies)
thin_capitalization_rules:
3:1 debt-to-equity ratio (2:1 for particular repo transactions) applies

Interest deductions limited to 20% of adjusted income

cfc_income: The CFC rule does not apply in cases where a foreign subsidiary has fixed facilities (e.g. office, factory) in a low-tax jurisdiction for the conduct of business, it manages or controls the business by itself, and the business is mainly performed in the jurisdiction. Even in this case, where passive income is more than 50% of gross income, the CFC rule applies. In cases where the passive income is between 50% and 5% of the foreign subsidiary’s gross income, the CFC rule will apply in a limited manner.       If annual income is KRW 200 million or less, then CFC rules do not apply.
thin_capitalization_rules:
2:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions) applies

Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA (financial institutions exempt)

cfc_income: CFC exempt if profits below EUR 750,000 or passive income below EUR 75,000 and CFC is not based or incorporated in a tax haven.
cfc_exemption: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
thin_capitalization_rules:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies for deduction up to EUR 3 million (certain financial institutions exempt)

Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA for deduction exceeding EUR 3 million (certain financial institutions exempt)

cfc_income: CFC exempt if country included in white list and not receiving special tax treatment (less than 50 percent of Lithuanian effective tax rate).
thin_capitalization_rules:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

Interest deductions limited to EUR 3 million or 30% of EBITDA

Rule does not apply if entity's debt-to-equity ratio is not (or at most 2 percentage-points) lower than the group-consolidated ratio

cfc_income: CFC exempt if i) not an artificial arrangement or ii) accounting profits below EUR 750,000 or less than 10% of operating costs.
cfc_exemption: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of EUR 3 million or 30% of EBITDA

cfc_income: None.
cfc_exemption: All income once a 20% passive threshold is met
thin_capitalization_rules:
3:1 debt to equity ratio for interest payments between related parties

Limits of 30% of adjusted taxable income and MXN 20 million in total interest expense apply

cfc_income: CFC exempt if not an artificial arrangement.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of EUR 1 million or 20% of EBITDA

cfc_income: Limited exemption for certain Australian CFCs or if CFC passes an active business test.
thin_capitalization_rules: Numerous restrictions on debt-to-equity ratio apply

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EEA country and not an artificial arrangement or located in tax treaty country and not mainly passive income.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds NOK 25 million

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states and Switzerland
cfc_income: CFC exempt if not an artificial arrangement.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds PLN 3 million

cfc_income:
CFC exempt if located in EU and EEA countries and not an artificial arrangement.

Other exemptions can apply.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of EUR 1 million or 30% of EBITDA

country_limitations: Countries with a tax treaty or Tax Information Exchange Agreement
cfc_income: None.
cfc_exemption: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA (financial institutions exempted)

cfc_income: Substantial economic activities exemption.
thin_capitalization_rules: 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EU and not an artificial arrangement.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds EUR 1 million

cfc_income: CFC exempt if located in EEA and not an artificial arrangement or located in white list countries.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds SEK 5 million

cfc_income: N/A
thin_capitalization_rules: Debt-to-equity ratios apply and vary by asset class

cfc_income: None.
thin_capitalization_rules: 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions) applies

cfc_income: Various exemptions can apply.
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds GBP 2 million

cfc_income: Exemptions for foreign high-taxed income can apply.
cfc_exemption: Passive, except for active income captured by GILTI
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the sum of business interest income, 30% of adjusted taxable income, and floor plan financing interest
